short_description: The Sundarbans is a vast forest in the coastal region of the Bay of Bengal, considered one of the natural wonders of the world.
Bangkok is the capital and most populous city of Thailand. It is known for its vibrant street life and cultural landmarks.
Bali is an Indonesian island known for its forested volcanic mountains, iconic rice paddies, beaches, and coral reefs.
Kuala Lumpur is the capital of Malaysia, known for its modern skyline including the iconic Petronas Twin Towers.
Ha Long Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and popular travel destination known for its emerald waters and thousands of towering limestone islands topped with rainforests.
Angkor Wat is a temple complex and the largest religious monument in the world, originally constructed as a Hindu temple dedicated to the god Vishnu for the Khmer Empire.
Cox's Bazar is known for having the longest natural sea beach in the world, an unbroken sandy shore that stretches for about 120 km.
Phuket is a rainforested, mountainous island in the Andaman Sea, has some of Thailand’s most popular beaches, mainly situated along the clear waters of the western shore.
Borobudur is a 9th-century Mahayana Buddhist temple in Magelang, Central Java, Indonesia, and the world's largest Buddhist temple.
Langkawi, officially known as Langkawi, the Jewel of Kedah, is an archipelago of 99 islands in the Andaman Sea, some 30 km off the mainland coast of northwestern Malaysia.
Hoi An Ancient Town is a well-preserved example of a Southeast Asian trading port dating from the 15th to the 19th century.
Siem Reap is the capital city of Siem Reap Province in northwestern Cambodia. It is a popular resort town and a gateway to the Angkor region.
